speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: SCENE I. A forest in the north of England.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Enter two Keepers, with cross-bows in their hands

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: Under this thick-grown brake we'll shroud ourselves;

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: For through this laund anon the deer will come;

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: And in this covert will we make our stand,

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: Culling the principal of all the deer.

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: I'll stay above the hill, so both may shoot.

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: That cannot be; the noise of thy cross-bow

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: Will scare the herd, and so my shoot is lost.

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: Here stand we both, and aim we at the best:

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: And, for the time shall not seem tedious,

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: I'll tell thee what befell me on a day

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: In this self-place where now we mean to stand.

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Here comes a man; let's stay till he be past.

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Enter KING HENRY VI, disguised, with a prayerbook

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: From Scotland am I stol'n, even of pure love,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To greet mine own land with my wishful sight.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: No, Harry, Harry, 'tis no land of thine;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Thy place is fill'd, thy sceptre wrung from thee,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Thy balm wash'd off wherewith thou wast anointed:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: No bending knee will call thee Caesar now,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: No humble suitors press to speak for right,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: No, not a man comes for redress of thee;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For how can I help them, and not myself?

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: Ay, here's a deer whose skin's a keeper's fee:

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: This is the quondam king; let's seize upon him.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Let me embrace thee, sour adversity,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For wise men say it is the wisest course.

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Why linger we? let us lay hands upon him.

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: Forbear awhile; we'll hear a little more.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My queen and son are gone to France for aid;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And, as I hear, the great commanding Warwick

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Is thither gone, to crave the French king's sister

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To wife for Edward: if this news be true,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Poor queen and son, your labour is but lost;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For Warwick is a subtle orator,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And Lewis a prince soon won with moving words.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: By this account then Margaret may win him;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For she's a woman to be pitied much:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Her sighs will make a battery in his breast;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Her tears will pierce into a marble heart;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The tiger will be mild whiles she doth mourn;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And Nero will be tainted with remorse,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To hear and see her plaints, her brinish tears.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Ay, but she's come to beg, Warwick to give;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: She, on his left side, craving aid for Henry,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: He, on his right, asking a wife for Edward.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: She weeps, and says her Henry is deposed;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: He smiles, and says his Edward is install'd;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That she, poor wretch, for grief can speak no more;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whiles Warwick tells his title, smooths the wrong,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Inferreth arguments of mighty strength,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And in conclusion wins the king from her,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: With promise of his sister, and what else,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To strengthen and support King Edward's place.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O Margaret, thus 'twill be; and thou, poor soul,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Art then forsaken, as thou went'st forlorn!

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Say, what art thou that talk'st of kings and queens?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: More than I seem, and less than I was born to:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: A man at least, for less I should not be;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And men may talk of kings, and why not I?

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Ay, but thou talk'st as if thou wert a king.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Why, so I am, in mind; and that's enough.

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: But, if thou be a king, where is thy crown?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My crown is in my heart, not on my head;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Not decked with diamonds and Indian stones,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Nor to be seen: my crown is called content:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: A crown it is that seldom kings enjoy.

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Well, if you be a king crown'd with content,

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Your crown content and you must be contented

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: To go along with us; for as we think,

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: You are the king King Edward hath deposed;

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: And we his subjects sworn in all allegiance

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Will apprehend you as his enemy.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But did you never swear, and break an oath?

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: No, never such an oath; nor will not now.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Where did you dwell when I was King of England?

speaker: Second Keeper
text_entry: Here in this country, where we now remain.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I was anointed king at nine months old;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My father and my grandfather were kings,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And you were sworn true subjects unto me:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And tell me, then, have you not broke your oaths?

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: No;

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: For we were subjects but while you were king.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Why, am I dead? do I not breathe a man?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Ah, simple men, you know not what you swear!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Look, as I blow this feather from my face,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And as the air blows it to me again,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Obeying with my wind when I do blow,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And yielding to another when it blows,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Commanded always by the greater gust;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Such is the lightness of you common men.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But do not break your oaths; for of that sin

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My mild entreaty shall not make you guilty.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Go where you will, the king shall be commanded;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And be you kings, command, and I'll obey.

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: We are true subjects to the king, King Edward.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: So would you be again to Henry,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If he were seated as King Edward is.

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: We charge you, in God's name, and the king's,

speaker: First Keeper
text_entry: To go with us unto the officers.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: In God's name, lead; your king's name be obey'd:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And what God will, that let your king perform;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And what he will, I humbly yield unto.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Exeunt
